articles.author: Howard Schneider, Francesco Canepa, Leika Kihara
articles.description: Top central banks continued with another round of interest rate hikes this week despite cooling inflation, but have now switched to a more cautious posture about further moves in a sign that a year-long round of global monetary tightening could be at an end.
articles.title: Global central banks begin policy shift as inflation cools

articles.author: Michael Erman
articles.description: Injectable versions of some widely-used cancer drugs including Johnson & Johnson's (JNJ.N) blockbuster multiple myeloma treatment Darzalex are likely to be excluded from new U.S. government price negotiations for years, drugmakers told Reuters, protecting billions in revenue.
articles.title: Focus: Drugmakers go under the skin, skirting early US Medicare price negotiations

articles.author: John O'Donnell
articles.description: Long before Europe faced its debt crisis, Sweden struggled through its own 1990s property crash. Now the country is preparing to use an old playbook to contain its problems.
articles.title: How the ghost of the 1990s property crash returned to haunt Sweden

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Biogen (BIIB.O) said it would buy biotech firm Reata Pharmaceuticals (RETA.O) for roughly $6.5 billion to expand its presence in the rare disease drugs market.
articles.title: Biogen to buy Reata for $6.5 bln to bulk up rare disease portfolio

articles.author: Tom Westbrook
articles.description: The yen gained in volatile trade and stocks and bonds dropped in Tokyo after the Bank of Japan said it would take a more flexible approach to pinning down long-term yields, while hopes for stimulus had Chinese stocks heading for a weekly gain.
articles.title: Yen jumps, Nikkei slides as BOJ bends yield policy

articles.author: David Milliken
articles.description: The Bank of England looks likely to raise rates by a quarter-point to 5.25% on Aug. 3, though economists and markets see a risk of a repeat of June's surprise half-point hike as inflation remains hotter than in other big economies.
articles.title: Bank of England set to raise rates to 5.25% as high inflation persists

articles.author: Joyce Lee
articles.description: From Intel (INTC.O) to Samsung (005930.KS), global chipmakers are celebrating the beginning of the end of a semiconductor supply glut, but the outlook for demand from customers outside the artificial intelligence (AI) industry remains gloomy.
articles.title: Chipmakers signal supply glut easing but demand recovery still slow

articles.author: Gerry Doyle, Han Huang, Jackie Gu
articles.description: As Ukraine fights back, mines left by Russian forces pose a problem for Kyiv's military — and civilians in liberated territory
articles.title: Russian land mines pose a persistent and deadly threat in Ukraine

articles.author: Krishn Kaushik
articles.description: A one-mile stretch of a highway in the lush green foothills of India's Manipur state has become the symbol of a vicious sectarian conflict that has killed over 180 people since May and severely dented the strongman image of Prime Minister Narendra Modi.
articles.title: Bunkers, sniper rifles: Deepening sectarian war in India dents Modi's image

articles.author: Katie Paul, Sheila Dang
articles.description: Meta Platforms (META.O) executives are heavily focused on boosting retention on their new Twitter rival Threads, after the app lost more than half of its users in the weeks following its buzzy launch, CEO Mark Zuckerberg told employees on Thursday.
articles.title: Meta plans retention 'hooks' for Threads as more than half of users leave app
